heroIntro:
Discover your peaceful retirement haven in Torre De La Horadada, Pilar de La Horadada. This beautifully designed 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment offers the relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle you've been dreaming of, without the premium price tag of popular island destinations. Priced at just €292,900 (€3,958/m²), this property represents exceptional value—40% less expensive than comparable homes in Spanish island markets, yet offering the same year-round sunshine, established expat community, and accessible healthcare that make Costa Blanca ideal for retirees.

Whether you're seeking an investment property that generates consistent rental income (typical weekly rates of €800), a full-time retirement residence, or a flexible holiday home, this apartment delivers on all fronts. The Costa Blanca property market has grown steadily (+8% year-on-year), making this an intelligent financial decision alongside your lifestyle upgrade.

Pilar de La Horadada welcomes an international community of retirees and remote professionals who've discovered what locals have always known: this corner of southern Costa Blanca offers authentic Spanish living, pristine beaches minutes away, and all the modern conveniences you need for comfortable, independent living. With 27 property images showcasing every detail, you can explore this gem from anywhere in the world.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern edge of Costa Blanca, where the Segura River valley meets the Mediterranean coast. This strategically positioned town combines quiet, residential charm with beach accessibility—the coastline is just minutes away by car. The geography here is gentle and Mediterranean: low mountains frame the inland area, while Blue Flag beaches dot the shoreline. The climate is exceptionally stable, with over 320 days of sunshine annually, mild winters (rarely below 10°C), and warm summers ideal for outdoor living. Unlike busier Costa Blanca hotspots further north, Pilar de La Horadada maintains a more authentically Spanish character while welcoming an international population. The wider region benefits from modern infrastructure, including proximity to Alicante airport and major roads connecting to Valencia and Murcia.
lifestyleSection: Life in Pilar de La Horadada unfolds at a deliberate, enjoyable pace. Your mornings might begin with coffee at a local café, conversation in English with fellow expat friends—the international community here is well-established and welcoming. Afternoons often involve a stroll through weekly markets brimming with fresh produce, or a drive to one of the nearby Blue Flag beaches for a swim. The expat infrastructure is mature: English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and medical facilities, removing many barriers that concern retirees moving abroad. Healthcare is excellent—regional hospitals within 30 minutes offer modern facilities with English-speaking doctors, and private clinics provide additional options. Weekly social clubs, golf clubs, walking groups, and dining experiences cater specifically to the international community. Restaurants range from authentic Spanish paella joints to international cuisine. The pace is unhurried but never boring—you control how active or relaxed your days become.
investmentSection: Beyond its appeal as a retirement residence, this property offers solid investment fundamentals. The Costa Blanca property market has appreciated 8% year-on-year, with Pilar de La Horadada benefiting from infrastructure improvements and growing international recognition. Investors typically achieve €800 per week rental income during peak season (June-September), with strong demand from British, Scandinavian, and international tourists. The €292,900 purchase price is substantially below the regional average of €2,200/m², yet the premium specification justifies the €3,958/m² valuation. Rental history in the area shows 40-50% occupancy rates achievable by professional property managers. For retirees, this means your property can generate income during months when you're away, offsetting community fees and maintenance costs while building equity in an appreciating market.
conclusion: This Torre De La Horadada apartment represents more than a property purchase—it's your gateway to a genuinely enriched retirement. You're acquiring exceptional value (40% less than island markets), a thriving expat community ready to welcome you, world-class healthcare, year-round sunshine, and proven investment fundamentals. The €292,900 price delivers everything that makes Costa Blanca legendary for retirees, without the premium pricing of overcrowded alternatives. Whether you envision full-time Mediterranean living, a flexible holiday residence, or an investment generating €800+ weekly rental income, this apartment delivers. Take the next step: contact us via WhatsApp to arrange a virtual tour, discuss financing options, or ask any questions about your new life in southern Spain. Your peaceful retirement awaits.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Pilar de La Horadada provides everything you need for comfortable daily living. Essential services, entertainment, and recreation are all within convenient reach, with minimal bureaucratic friction and English-language support throughout the community.

healthcare.text: Healthcare was likely a key concern before moving abroad—it shouldn't be. The region offers excellent medical facilities with English-speaking professionals. San Bartolomé Hospital in nearby Orihuela (28 minutes) is a modern regional facility with emergency departments, specialist services, and international patient coordination. Private clinics throughout the area offer faster appointment times and are often preferred by expats. Pharmacies display an 'A' sign and are abundant—Spanish pharmacists can often advise on minor health issues without requiring a doctor's visit. Once registered with Spain's healthcare system (simple process), you're entitled to public healthcare matching standards in northern Europe. Many retirees appreciate having both public and private options available.

education.text: While you may be past school-age, many retirees have grandchildren visiting or relocating family members. The region offers international schools following British, American, and IB curricula. Orihuela has established international schools within 20-30 minutes, providing English-language education and familiar teaching methods. Adult education is also available through expat networks, with language courses, art classes, and hobby groups regularly organized. Universities in nearby cities like Alicante offer lifelong learning programs and cultural courses.

shopping.text: Daily shopping is convenient and affordable. Mercadona, Spain's dominant supermarket chain, operates several locations within 5 minutes, offering competitive prices and quality products. Lidl provides budget options for staples. Weekly markets in Pilar de La Horadada and surrounding towns burst with fresh vegetables, fruits, fish, and regional specialties at prices often 30-40% below UK levels. For larger purchases or branded goods, the Torrevieja Shopping Center (15 minutes) offers department stores, fashion retailers, and entertainment. Online shopping via Amazon.es has expanded significantly, with next-day delivery common in this region.

transport.text: While a car provides maximum flexibility, it's not essential. Bus connections link Pilar de La Horadada to surrounding towns, beaches, and larger centers. Alicante-Elche Airport is 45 minutes by car—perfectly positioned for visits to the UK (2.5-hour flights), France, or exploring southern Spain by road. The road infrastructure is excellent with modern motorways (autopistas) connecting to major cities. Parking is generally straightforward and inexpensive. Many retirees maintain a car for independence and weekend adventures, while using buses for regular town travel.

faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €292,900. This price includes a premium-specification 2-bedroom apartment with modern finishes, excellent location, and proven rental potential. It represents 40% savings compared to similar properties in Spanish island markets. Flexible payment plans and mortgage options are available for qualified buyers.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination. The market has appreciated 8% year-on-year, it offers diverse rental income opportunities (this property achieves €800/week typical), and property costs remain significantly lower than Mediterranean alternatives. The region combines lifestyle appeal with financial fundamentals.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can buy property in Spain without restrictions or visas required specifically for property purchase. You'll need a Spanish tax number (NIE), which is straightforward to obtain. The process typically takes 4-8 weeks with proper legal representation, ensuring all documentation is in order.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-10% in taxes and fees beyond the property price. This breaks down as: 6% transfer tax, 1.5% stamp duty, legal fees (1-2%), and notary fees (0.5-1%). For this €292,900 property, expect approximately €25,000-35,000 in additional costs. Financing options reduce immediate cash requirements.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is exceptionally popular with retirees for excellent reasons: established English-speaking expat communities, year-round sunshine (320+ days annually), excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors, cost of living 30-40% below UK levels, and proximity to beaches. Pilar de La Horadada specifically offers authentic Spanish living combined with all these retirement essentials.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is approximately 30-40% lower than the UK. Groceries at Mercadona cost roughly 40% less than Tesco prices. Utilities (€80-120 monthly), dining out (€8-15 per meal), and activities are proportionally affordable. For retirees, a comfortable lifestyle typically requires €1,200-1,600 monthly beyond property costs.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing (IBI - Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) run approximately 0.4-0.6% of property value yearly. For this €292,900 property, expect €1,200-1,800 annually. This is collected alongside community fees (typically €80-150 monthly for managed buildings). Both are lower than UK council taxes for equivalent properties.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, most major Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typical terms are 60-80% LTV (loan-to-value ratio) at competitive rates. For this €292,900 property, borrowing €175,000-235,000 is achievable with proper income documentation. UK and EU pension income qualifies for mortgage calculations.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 45 minutes from Pilar de La Horadada. Direct flights to London, Manchester, and Birmingham take 2.5 hours. Budget airlines operate multiple daily flights at affordable rates (€50-150 return), making UK visits frequent and convenient for retirees maintaining family connections.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys 320+ days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 17°C (winter) to 29°C (summer). Rainfall is minimal (200mm annually). This Mediterranean climate means comfortable outdoor living year-round, minimal heating expenses, and reliable beach access. Winter rarely requires heating beyond a few hours daily.
